org.cougaar.core.mobility.ldm
Interface AgentControl

All Superinterfaces:
java.io.Serializable, UniqueObject
public interface AgentControl
extends UniqueObject

Request an agent management operation, as defined in the getAbstractTicket().

Abstract tickets allow add / remove / move of agents.

See Also:
backwards compatible API for agent mobility.

Method Detail

getUID

UID getUID()
UID support from unique-object.

Specified by:
getUID in interface UniqueObject
Returns:
the UID of this UniqueObject.

getOwnerUID

UID getOwnerUID()
Get the optional UID of the object that "owns" this agent control request.

getSource

MessageAddress getSource()
Get the agent that created this request.

getTarget

MessageAddress getTarget()
Get the agent that should perform the operation.

For agent mobility this should be eithe the mobile agent itself or the node containing the mobile agent. This must agree with the ticket.

Note that the behavior is different depending upon the target. If the node is specified then the request is not passed through the agent.

getAbstractTicket

AbstractTicket getAbstractTicket()
The addresses specified in the ticket are not null.

getStatusCode

int getStatusCode()
Get the move status code, which is one of the above "*_STATUS" constants.

Initially the status is "NO_STATUS".

getStatusCodeAsString

java.lang.String getStatusCodeAsString()
Get a string representation of the status.

getFailureStackTrace

java.lang.Throwable getFailureStackTrace()
If (getStatusCode() == FAILED_STATUS), this is the failure exception.

setStatus

void setStatus(int statusCode,
               java.lang.Throwable stack)
For infrastructure use only! Set the status.
